question: At which of the following places Dost Mohammad Khan was deported as a prisoner after the first Anglo Afghan War?
explanation: A tripartite treaty was signed between Ranjit Singh, Shah Shuja and the British (Lord Auckland) in June 1838 . After that the First Anglo-Afghan War was started in 1839 between the British East India Company and Afghanistan. Dost Mohammad Khan was deported as a prisoner in Calcutta and Shah Shuja ascended the throne.
